item.title: Hurricane Melissa is the strongest storm on the planet this year
item.description: <p>With sustained winds of 281km/h, Melissa is now one of the strongest hurricanes, based on top wind speeds, on record in the Atlantic basin.</p>

item.title: Western Sydney Airport survives first test landing of passenger jet
item.description: <p>I﻿t marks another milestone as the airport inches closer to opening to passengers and commercial flights.</p>

item.title: Half a million Aussies have three days to dodge $1650 fine
item.description: <p>T﻿he deadline for filing a tax return arrives on Friday, October 31, and penalties will follow.</p>

item.title: Police raid offices of Australian software giant WiseTech
item.description: <p>O﻿fficers seized documents linked to alleged trading by its billionaire co-founder and three other employees.</p>

item.title: Body found in search for missing NSW hang-glider
item.description: <p>A 59-year-old man took off at Lindeman&#x27;s Point near Forster, but had not been heard from or seen since.</p>

item.title: Telcos forced to make outages public in real-time with fines for triple-zero failures increased to $30 million
item.description: <p>The federal government is trying to ﻿rebuild Australia&#x27;s confidence in the triple-zero system after three people died in an Optus outage last month. </p>

item.title: 'Living in anxiety every day': Japanese governor requests military to cull bears after terrifying rise in atta
item.description: <p>T﻿he exhausted governor said the situation is now &quot;beyond the scope that only prefectures and municipalities can handle&quot;. </p>

item.title: Tech giant Amazon eyeing 30,000 job cuts: report
item.description: <p>T﻿he company warned AI would lead to a smaller workforce in the future.</p>

item.title: Isolated Indigenous groups could vanish within a decade, experts warn
item.description: <p>R﻿emote tribes are being squeezed by roads, miners and drug traffickers, putting their survival at risk, a new report says.</p>

item.title: CCTV captures moment Porsche collides with two cars on Sydney street
item.description: <p>T﻿he 40-year-old driver of the Porsche was taken to hospital with minor injuries. </p>

item.title: Aussies demand Woolworths bring back plant-based staples quietly vanishing from shelves
item.description: <p>&quot;My local store, it just looks really empty,&quot; said the woman behind the movement.</p>

item.title: Victorian ski resort dips to record low temperature as cold air mass leaves multiple states shivering
item.description: <p>Victorian ski resort Falls Creek has recorded its coldest October night in 19 years, with temperatures plunging to -6.6 degrees.﻿</p>

item.title: Queensland Police deputy commissioner to retire
item.description: <p>Queensland Police Deputy Commissioner Shane Chelepy has today announced his retirement from the service after almost 40 years.</p>

item.title: Queensland premier slams 'flawed' new Bureau of Meteorology website
item.description: <p>The Bureau of Metreology&#x27;s $4 million website revamp has been criticised for leaving Queenslanders unprepared for the weekend&#x27;s severe storms.</p>

item.title: Aaron Bernath jailed for 28 years over father's 'callous' and 'abhorrent' killing
item.description: <p>Seventeen minutes after repeatedly bashing his father in the head with a baseball bat, a murderous son called for an ambulance.</p>

item.title: Gas power to be outlawed in most new buildings in Sydney
item.description: <p>New buildings in Sydney will be required to be fully electrified.</p>

item.title: Hannah McGuire's killer 'motivated by male entitlement'
item.description: <p>Lachlan Young admitted he strangled her in the bathroom of their Sebastopol home about 2.30am on April 5.</p>

item.title: Indigenous crisis hotline records surge after March for Australia protests
item.description: <p>The hotline will receive at least 33,200 calls this year as Indigenous Australians fear for their safety. </p>

item.title: Controversial youth detention centre to reopen as new bail laws keep youth offenders in custody
item.description: <p>Malmsbury Youth Detention Centre will reopen 30 beds next year to house youth offenders remanded in custody under the government&#x27;s new bail laws.</p>

item.title: Woman, 42, charged after allegedly vandalising water and gas mains at hospitals in Sydney
item.description: <p>A﻿ woman has been charged after allegedly vandalising water and gas mains at two separate hospitals in Sydney&#x27;s south this morning.</p>

item.title: Australia quietly transfers first NZYQ member to Nauru under controversial $408 million deal
item.description: <p>The deal was officially activated upon the first detainee&#x27;s transfer. ﻿</p>

item.title: Sussan Ley wants apology from Anthony Albanese for wearing Joy Division T-shirt
item.description: <p>Albanese was snapped disembarking from his Air Force charter jet on Thursday wearing a tee of Unknown Pleasures, the 1979 debut album of British post-punk band Joy Division.</p>

item.title: Police probe home invasion link as 76-year-old describes confrontation with armed intruders
item.description: <p>Police are investigating a link between two frightening home invasions that targeted a family of six and a grandmother in Melbourne&#x27;s south-east.</p>

item.title: Top court fight looms over woman's terror flag charge
item.description: <p>2﻿0-year-old Sarah Mouhanna allegedly displayed a prohibited flag at a pro-Palestinian rally in September last year.</p>

item.title: Most Aussies – particularly younger ones – neglecting important financial task, report finds

item.description: <p>L﻿ast year, New South Wales Premier Chris Minns said he would cut nine holes from the Moore Park golf course. </p>

item.description: <p>Police believe a missing grey ute could provide crucial information to detectives.</p>

item.title: Sydney mum sent anonymous note threatening to poison barking dogs
item.description: <p>The Sydney woman said she received a typed note in the mail which demanded she &quot;do something&quot; about her barking dogs.</p>

item.title: Scientist's shark tag washes up on Gold Coast beach
item.description: <p>A lost satellite tag that washed up on a Gold Coast beach has been reunited with scientists after detaching from a great white shark.</p>

item.title: Almost 11,000 insurance claims made after Brisbane storms
item.description: <p>More than 5000 customers are still without power and almost 11,000 insurance claims have been made after Brisbane&#x27;s severe storms on Sunday.</p><p><strong></strong></p>

item.title: Queensland's puberty blocker ban overturned in landmark court battle
item.description: <p>A mother, who cannot be named, launched legal action after Queensland became the first to ban hormone treatments for children diagnosed with gender dysphoria.</p>

item.title: Woman found dead on Lizard Island after failing to board cruise ship
